TextBlock.TextLine: In Antwerp 5 July 1681
aondon abram vivian
Sr. sence mij last to you of 28 past, receaved yd of 17 ditto, where bij I observe how
you are pressed for mony, I hope my last remise shall have given you some
succour & was itt not now the deadest time of all the yeare, both in
selling & receaving of mony, I would be more forward in remitting
yett I hope you will gett through whilst I shall endeavour to make you
an other remise p. first & that you might see I am not backward on
yd acctt. do send here in closed invoyces of one packett of laces N.:17
am. to Â£85:9:10 flemish for which please to give mee creditt
accordingly itt is to be shipped att Brugges aboard one John Collinier or in Dovere
so that they shall bring each one packett of which mr. Coots shall give you
the advise, I take this to be good opportunitie, the more, because I understand
that severall packetts are seased on att Dover & these schippers can easely
dimm each a packett, which is ernstely enough recommended to them
& I hope they will come quickley so hand by these you will so the names
oof the makers, so that you can butt advise which doth best, & of whoes worch
you will have next week shall follow the last packett: hopeing you
receaved that of clarck before now: the goods out of John nelison are
with mee, & have onely opened the dozins which I finde indifferent en
like them vere well thought singely tollitted, I exspect the
& when I shall have seen more, shall advise you, mee thinckes you will do
well to keep m. potter, butt I have not seen yett yd other freinds doing so when
all is here shall be able to tell you, which to imploy for the future, god
send us good sall after harvest & store of mony I have given you ered itt
for my feare in the bale N.36: & with kinde saluts
London muchel Beeters
monsr. Den ul van 17 passate is mij wel geworden in den eerst tis mij let
d'afsterven van ul broeder john daer in ons eghter hall wat n
dewerelt passeirt moeten getroften, als dependerende vanden wille
en maght godts: Ick hadde ul broeder in sijn leven noch gesproken en hij
hoopte hier te comen, nu mons. Antonio heeft mij gescreven om te
weten wanneer ick tijt soude hebbe over d'affaires van mons. slanghter
te advisteeren, waer op hem hebbe geantwoort als hem geliefde ende
dat hoe eerder hoe beter om diewill mons verspert noch
hier is, den welke van ul broeder John versoeght was, en geinformeert
teassisteren, bovendien monsr. slaughter presseirt seer omde
rest erende goederen te doen verkoopen gelt dat gelt: ende ick heb het
al tot nochtoe op gehonden: want dat soude ul te veel schadelijk
sijn, ende het deel vant capitael niet maken vande gelle
coleuren, dat se ul selfs kosten, soo doet u debvoor bij hem dat
hij die gale coleuren wederneimt, ende ick salse senden, en geloove
gett konnen bij de werck brengen tot voldoenige van sijn heel pretentie
alles dependeirt van goede directie, waertoe ul geerne helpe verscherende
ul van mijne genegentheyt om een eijnde te hebben De eerderde beter
in gesloten sijn de stalen vande resterende lakens, kan ul hem deniedecolen
alleen aenpreken, men sal wel gelt vinden voorde rest, alsoude
ul selfs op den in koop verbjen, want sij hier onverkoop baegen
@ 5 ditto 1681
soo dan verwaght antwoort p alderberte
th
th
L ondon Henry Collier
Sr. my last to you was on the 28: past. sence recd. yd of 17: ditto as to the
concernes of T.H. wee have not yett delivered him yd answer, because
I tought good to shew itt to our lawer which is absent & I have translats
itt so shall in large more pr. next hopeing to gett him in away, either
to comply, or to persecute what he hath in writing this m
H comes here & desire you to send the 2 last letters of T
or any others, by which h itt might apeare that he was & is
suelen e es dn p rre mot de: se ver soude mart yd ith ee
when you drew the bills he was, yd debtor, butt that wee want not yett
wee will procure full & absolute sentence first & proceed with promise
to procure such oath if there unto required to I have recd yd bale N.38
butt is not yett opened, because now itt is the deadest time of all the yeare
& yett you continew drawing mony doth not come in accordinglys so
must desire you not to be so forward: yd acctt; pr first beeng a makeing up
of my bookes & to ballance June as Jan used to do twice a yeare
I have accepted the bill of m. knightley of which past Â£93: att 35:11
to yds acctt. & shall pay the Â£53:5 you desired, butt itt had been better for
you to give yd note to francus foster: I have this day drawne on you Â£60
payable to mr. Arthur Anneslay att 2 uso for which you have given you credit
att 35:5 & which please to accept & pass to acctt. accordingly, intrim you
say tis good time to buy cottons: in case you can meet with good goods
itt will not be to send 4 a 5 bales assorted from 20 to 26 pence a
goad, butt you must have good & white goods, or non and lett each bale have
half a peece for wrapper which is the needfull att present from
a word in answer of the condition of mr. Edmund warner -
Antw 5 July
th
London Arthur Anneslay
S. my last to you was on the 2 curitt with a remise of Â£50 on mr. francus
th
miller, sence recd. yd of 20: past: for my half part in the goods shipt aboard
thomas Elsdon have given you creditt exspect to have the patt. yd bill shall
finde acceptance, & due complgame as also when you draw more for my:
acctt. you haveing don well to give the necessary orders to mr. wood about
the more desired 90 serges in which desire him to be expedient, & pray
lett me know when Elsdon departs inclosed my bill for Â£60 st on m
Henrj Collier att 2 uso for which please to give yd acctt creditt att 35:5
you shall have yd acctt; pr first & more mony remitted without faile
because I will I endeavour to keep you from complaints whilst I remain
@ 5 Julij 1681
London Henry Maynard
th
Sr. my last to you was on the 28: past sence non from you, so this
for covert of the inclosed bill for Â£100 s due the curitt att the
charge of John Hilleisdon for which please to procure the valew & pass
to my accompt I have desired you to provide a bale of reds, which
I must intreat you to expediate before all others sence the widow
bouwens & du mont dyed every one beleaves that the rest of that
trade are rich enough, & that no trade be better, where fore do envie
itt, in so much that severall prepare new ware houses, & begum to sett
up, though itt zeems that the relations & heires of du mont will
maintenaine theire that trade my meanino is to desire, you to
serve non in this towne butt mee either for yds or their accompt
which in case you do would be preiuditiall to our comp. which I doubt
not, butt will nive you content for this yeares sale, becaused hetherto
I found itt reasonable, which I hope you will approve off when
you shall see the acctts & comply there in to serve not boddy Elce whils
In Antwerpen 7 July 1681
no nes yett of white -
Brugge Raphael Coots
mijn sH. op 4 deser aen ul een packie canten gesonden sedert den ul van selve
dato bekomen, de noodigh orders sijn in mijn vorrger vermest & aengesien
schip hobert fax subtile sereten seght te hebben sal vrijdagh noch ean
packie canten senden om met den selve voorts te laten gaen An waer
mr. Abram vivien dat anders ordonneerde, dereden de welke al aligeert
soo over de packen van collinier als schip van B: klarck & smith hebbe
een goet colleur, ende hadde die oock soo verwacht de packen uyt smith
sien te gemoet wensche dat thomas whit magh gearriveert sijn
houden bedencken waerden selve tardeert de diffente Rek sal exammeer
ende ul volgens creditteeren t geen up salde comt sal prompt betaelen
al hoewel voor dese reyse ul not moet de layeeren daer over tedipon
soo lanck alst sonder ul preseteee kan geschieden want ick present
geseel tael ben Aen boort sleven Werner van Londonis voor
